document_title: Chronic heart failure: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Because chronic heart failure can happen to anyone, it's important to take lifelong preventative measures to ensure heart health. This is a long-term condition that requires ongoing treatment to prevent complications. When the disease is left untreated, the heart can weaken so severely that it causes life-threatening complications. (4)
Symptoms will likely get worse over time. Initially, medications and surgery may help relieve symptoms but may not be helpful if the person has severe chronic heart failure. Early treatment is key to preventing the most serious cases of chronic heart failure.
